Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Earrings
Description: Pair of ear or hair ornaments carved from the tip of bivalve shells (cone type), which give them their convex shape.  The edges were later polished. This type of ornament is frequently found in the oldest Nubian cultures, like the Old Kerma and C-Group cultures.
